Hi,
=C2=A0The setups I employed are Linux 2.x.x/3.x.x with GCC 4.x.x, Windo=
ws XP SP3 with Visual Studio 2010. It seems that one of the libraries I rel=
y on, jsoncpp 0.5.0, have troubles to compile with MSVC 2009, which you see=
ms to use. I upgraded the package to version 0.6.0, which is said to fix th=
at issue. You can try again. You make a wonderful compilation oddities hone=
ypot, and I'm sorry of that ^^

=C2=A0http://www.marmakoide.org/content/cod=
e/index.html

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Alexan=
dre Devert <marmakoide@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> =C3=82=C2=A0 I fixed the compi=
lation problem for Windows & MSVC. Compiled and ran as expected on a Window=
s XP & MSVC 2010 setup. You can get it there
> http://www.marmakoide.org/co=
ntent/code/index.html
> 
> =C3=82=C2=A0
> One oddity for the Windows people=
 : if you don't set the random seed manually, the system clock time will be=
 used as a seed. Thus, 2 instances of the program at the same time, might h=
ave the same random seed. Unix builds do not have such an oddity.
> 
> 
> A=
lex
> 
> 
> ________________________________

carl2@...>
> =C3=83=E2=82=AC=C3=82=C2=A0: neat@yahoogroups.com

fectiveness of the CMA-ES method in instances of small sample size and high=

> Andy

dom seed. Unix builds do not have such an oddity.<br>
